title: Black box when printing crossword
content:
I have used firefox for a long time and make regular small payments. I hope it survives.

One thing that has bugged me for a while is that I can't print my weekly crossword. Instead of the grid I get a black box. To print I have to either go to Edge :( or print a pdf. These are obviously doable but my preferred option is the "print" function.

My crosswords are like this: https://www.theguardian.com/crosswords/cryptic/29102/print

Print preview gives me a black square. It will print a black square if I actually print. It is the same in safe mode.

The grid on the page is not an image, it is (svg?) code along these lines with <g> and <rect> tags: 

<rect x="0" y="0" width="481" height="481" class="crossword__grid-background"></rect>      <g class="cells">      <g>        <rect x="1" y="1" width="31" height="31"></rect>        <text x="2.0" y="10.0">1</text>      </g><g>

The printer driver is fully udated but a red herring, because I get the same print preview for print to pdf, XPS etc. I have looked at the print processor based on a support thread from 2013 but that appears to be a red herring too.

I am always on the latest Firefox on Windows 11 Home.

I would be interested to know if I am unique or if this can be replicated. If it can be replicated I would be keen to have a fix.

(I would pint from my android phone, but the recent versions will not let me share to printer any more. That is another frustration).
creator: thomas309

title: Recovering Bookmarks
content:
Hello,

Hoping the team can give me a hand. My PC was acting wonky 5-30-23 & I was forced to do a factory reset. When I downloaded Firefox to my PC, I expected to sign in and regain access to my beloved bookmarks in which i spent yrs. setting it up. I've looked thru the support pages and followed some steps, but i can't find profiles past 5-31-23. Is it possible that it's saved somewhere in your guys system? Some of my bookmarks pertain to my grandmother's health care items/webpage, some of which were specific sites that would allow us to access her (old) account.

I apologize in advance for the inconvenience, trouble, & prob. newb request.

Wishing the team a pleasant rest of day/night.

Sincerely,

Kathy
creator: practical.missing

title: Dictionary.com Won't Display IPA Correctly on Mac
content:
I use dictionary.com daily for work with non-native English speaking students, but Firefox, my preferred browser, won't display the International Phonetic Alphabet characters correctly and replaces them with squares. I have tried using the Inspector to see what fonts they are using, but it appears to be "Arial, sans serif" which is a default font, to my knowledge (see image). However, in looking at another post on the help forum here, I saw someone suggest downloading and installing IPA fonts, which I did. However, the website still will not show the characters/symbols correctly when I try to look at the IPA pronunciation rather than the "Phonetic Respelling".

Anyone have any luck getting IPA to show up in FF on Macs for dictionary.com?
creator: eslteachersue

title: Firefox logo Youtube most of the time has terrible connection speed
content: YouTube videos I try to load get stuck around 500-1200 kbps connection speed inside of the stats for nerds section. I had this same problem about a week ago and the solution I was told was this was the problem: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1415738#answer-1585257. I changed it and it made it better, sometimes videos would load at full speed, which is about 400 Mbps when I went to 4k, but most of the time I have to keep refreshing until I get full speed. It's so weird, and I don't have the problem with other browsers, but I prefer to use Firefox, what do I do?

title: I just want to open a .pdf file online . . . but Firefox insists on downloading it!
content:
OS: Mac OS 10.14.5 Firefox Version: 113.0.2

Settings gives me multiple options for handling a .pdf file. The first three are (1) Open in Firefox; (2) Always ask; and (3) Save File.

If I select "Open in Firefox," the file will open in my existing window. If I select "Save File," the file downloads to my desktop.

The problem arises when I select "Always ask." If I then select "Open in Firefox," the file opens (in a new tab!) and simultaneously downloads to my desktop!

Is this a system glitch, or am I somehow doing something wrong?
creator: nhcowboy1
